citation.article-title: Lactobacillus concavus sp. nov., isolated from the walls of a distilled spirit fermenting cellar in China
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus concavus sp. nov.
Lactobacillus concavus (con.ca′vus. L. adj. concavus curved, referring to the curved shape of the strains).
Cells are Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, non-motile curved rods, about 0·5–0·6×2·0–2·5 μm in size after 24 h incubation in anaerobic MRS liquid medium.
Colonies are white, convex and smooth with an entire margin.
Colonies are about 1 mm in diameter after 24 h cultivation on anaerobic MRS plates.
Lactic acid [about 5 % (−)-d and 95 % (+)-l], but no gas, is produced from glucose and gluconate fermentation.
The diagnostic diamino acid in the cell-wall peptidoglycan is meso-DAP.
The optimum temperature for growth is 30–37 °C; the temperature ranges for growth for C-5-1T and HB5 are 10–42 °C and 10–39 °C, respectively.
Optimum pH is 6·0–6·4; the pH ranges for growth of C-5-1T and HB5 are 3·8–8·1 and 4·3–8·1, respectively.
Growth can occur in 8 % (v/v) ethanol, but not in 6·5 % (w/v) NaCl.
Aesculin is hydrolysed but arginine is not hydrolysed.
Acid is produced from d-glucose, N-acetylglucosamine, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, trehalose and β-gentiobiose.

Acid is not produced from glycerol, erythritol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-xyloside, galactose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, inulin, melezitose, d-raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, d-turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate or 5-ketogluconate.
Fermentation of d-fructose and amygdalin is variable.
The DNA G+C content is 46·9±0·8 mol% (46·4 mol% for the type strain, C-5-1T).
The type strain, C-5-1T (=AS 1.5017T=LMG 22739T), was isolated from the walls of a distilled spirit fermenting cellar in Hebei province, China.
